page.title: 03GAZETTEER (Continued)
page.content: is barely surviving as a separate entity - kept alive by its two inns and its caravan/campsite. Similarly, all new building is, at present, taking place in and around Slimbridge so any community growth is bound to take place there leaving Cambridge to remain as almost a living museum for future generations. The steady growth of Slimbridge in recent times has partly been brought about by the good road links enjoyed by the area which mean that residents can quickly reach several large towns or cities. Consequently, there is a very real danger that there will be an even greater demand for residential accommodation in the area with an inevitable loss of some of the local countryside.
